metadata.synopsis: In the desert near Los Angeles, a beautiful woman named Allison Pond (Jennifer Connelly) is found murdered. A special investigative unit led by hard-edged detective Max Hoover (Nick Nolte) is brought in when it looks like the victim may have ties to a secret military program. But Hoover has his own secret: Unbeknown to his adoring wife (Melanie Griffith), Allison is his ex-mistress, and her friend Jimmy Fields (Andrew McCarthy) has secretly filmed pornographic evidence of their affair.

reviews: Tamahori struggles to find a character balance that brings out the intended feeling of partnership and personal sacrifice.
It may betray its genre intentions, but it's nevertheless well-acted and routinely entertaining.
The cast is really good, the story is interesting but it was kind of a let down at the end.
An imperfect but still entertaining neo-noir mystery.
...a watchable endeavor that's nevertheless a marked disappointment...
How could it miss? Let me count the ways.
An uneven mystery-thriller that suffers from a plot that wanders in too many directions and an overabundance of underdeveloped characters.
A great cast helps this wandering modern noir a whole heck of a lot.
After watching Lee Tamahori's failed, cameo-studded attempt at neo-noir, one can only wonder how it attracted such an interesting array of talent.
It didn't make any sense, but it was great!
Standard mystery, not nearly enough for Jennifer Connolly to do.
